message: I don't think you can. guessing because it's tied to urls
@mlinsey but i like to know why they are doing that
@bat spam? seriously there are better ways to prevent spam then a throwaway account
how to change the topic on convore?
If the companies lose out on good recruits because they are too overly cautious about anything that would reveal themselves, that only hurts them. Dunno why you would care.

I don't understand the reason behind using a throwaway account on HN when a YC company is looking for employees. Maybe you are still under stealth mode, but at least tell people about your company, why even use a throwaway gmail and throwaway HN account. It's annoying.
that is just an example of a really bad I'm fucking YC co, hiring and you want to work for my cool anonymous company
...where a human is making an unwanted offer, is trickier than regular spam
I think it's to prevent spam

The email address is probably a bit off-putting. If the applicant has no concept for what a throwaway address is, it could look like a random place holder that they forgot to replace with a real email address.
Using a 'throwaway' account is both childish and pretentious, and makes one think 'what do they have to hide?'
